Line 63: Line 63:
In 2009, [[Bobby Hauck]] became the subject of national controversy when he refused to take questions from the Kaimin following the paper's story about an alleged assault by two Grizzly football players. <ref>{{cite news|first=Chelsi |last=Moy |url=http://missoulian.com/news/local/article_8dff530e-c05c-11de-89ed-001cc4c002e0.html |title=Bobby Hauck, Kaimin feud goes viral |publisher=Missoulian.com |date=2009-10-24 |accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref>
In 2009, [[Bobby Hauck]] became the subject of national controversy when he refused to take questions from the Kaimin following the paper's story about an alleged assault by two Grizzly football players. <ref>{{cite news|first=Chelsi |last=Moy |url=http://missoulian.com/news/local/article_8dff530e-c05c-11de-89ed-001cc4c002e0.html |title=Bobby Hauck, Kaimin feud goes viral |publisher=Missoulian.com |date=2009-10-24 |accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref>
In the fall of 2010 the Kaimin changed to a tabloid format once a week, known as the Friday Kaimin. The new format put a focus on long form feature stories, in a more magazine like fashion.
In the fall of 2010 the Kaimin changed to a tabloid format once a week, known as the Friday Kaimin. The new format put a focus on long form feature stories, in a more magazine like fashion.
